definition: to bow again/to bow twice (gesture of respect in former times)/(in letters, an expression of respect)
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)

sentences.english: For example if you really love God, will you want any other god?
sentences.chinese: 舉例說，你如果真的愛神，你怎會再拜其他偶像？

sentences.english: Rhododendron Zaibai carefree tears, infinite heart Jingwei reclamation.
sentences.chinese: 杜鵑再拜憂天淚，精衛無窮填海心。

definition: to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to kneel as in prayer (without sitting back on the heels)
to kowtow (touch the forehead to the floor)
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
